tuv.seg: Free movement of people within the Schengen Area
Saoirse gluaiseachta daoine laistigh de limistéar Schengen
The Schengen Convention is an agreement among some European states which allows for the abolition of systematic border controls between the participating countries
Is comhaontú é Coinbhinsiún Schengen i measc stáit Eorpacha áirithe, a cheadaíonn rialuithe teorann córasacha idir thíortha rannpháirteacha a chur ar ceal

It also includes provisions on common policy on the temporary entry of people (including the Schengen Visa), the harmonisation of external border controls, and cross-border police and judicial co-operation

Áirítear ann forálacha ar chomhbheartas maidir le hiontráil shealadach daoine (lena n-áirítear Víosa Schengen), comhchuibhiú na rialuithe teorann seachtracha, agus póilíní trasteorann agus comhoibriú breithiúnach
The name of the Convention comes from the name of the village Schengen in Luxembourg where the Agreement was signed in 1985
Tagann ainm an Choinbhinsiúin ón tsráidbhaile Schengen i Lucsamburg inar síníodh an Comhaontú sa bhliain 1985
A total of 26 states have implemented the agreement so far
Tá an comhaontú curtha i bhfeidhm ag 26 stát ag an bpointe seo
Border posts and checks have been removed between Schengen area states and a common Schengen visa (see below) allows tourist or visitor access to the area
Tá pointí agus seiceálacha teorann bainte amach idir na stáit limistéir Schengen agus tugann víosa choiteann Schengen (féach thíos) cead rochtana nó cuairte chuig an limistéar
The initial 15 states that implemented the agreement are Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain and Sweden

Tá an comhaontú curtha i bhfeidhm cheana féin ag na 15 stát seo a leanas: an Ostair, an Bheilg, an Danmhairg, an Fhionlainn, an Fhrainc, an Ghearmáin, an Ghréig, An Íoslainn, an Iodáil, Lucsamburg, an Ísitír, an Iorua, an Phortaingéil, an Spáinn agus an tSualainn
The Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Poland, Slovakia and Slovenia implemented it on 21 December 2007 for land and sea borders and in March 2008 for air borders

Dhéin Poblacht na Seice, an Eastóin, an Ungáir, an Laitvia, an Liotuáin, Málta, an Pholainn, an tSlóvaic agus an tSlóivéin an comhaontú a chur i bhfeidhm ar an 21 Nollaig 2007 do theorainneacha talún agus farraige, agus do theorainneacha aeir i Márta 2008
Switzerland implemented the agreement for land borders on 12 December 2008 and for air borders in March 2009
Dhein an Eilvéis an comhaontú a chur i bhfeidhm ar an 12 Nollaig 2008 do theorainneacha talún agus do theorainneacha aeir i Márta 2009
Liechtenstein implemented the agreement fully on 19 December 2011
Dhein Lichtinstein an comhaontú a chur i bhfeidhm ar an 19 Nollaig 2011
Bulgaria and Romania are in the process of implementing it
Tá sé mar aidhm ag an mBulgáir agus ag an Rómáin í a chur i bhfeidhm
Ireland and the UK have applied to take part only in the police and criminal judicial co-operation measures and not the common border control and visa provisions
Tá iarratas déanta ag Éirinn agus an Ríocht Aontaithe le bheith páirteach sna bearta comhoibrithe póilíneachta agus breithiúnacha amháin
The Schengen arrangements deal with travel between the participating states
Déileálann socruithe Schengen le taisteal idir na stáit rannpháirteacha
They do not affect the rights of people to live and work in other countries
Níl tionchar acu ar chearta daoine ó thaobh cónaithe agus oibre i dtíortha eile
This is covered by EU directives and regulations on free movement of people
Tá sé seo clúdaithe ag treoracha agus rialacháin an AE ar saoirse aistrithe daoine
The Schengen countries have implemented the following arrangements:
Tá na socruithe a leanas curtha i bhfeidhm ag tíortha Schengen:
• They have common rules about entry and short stay visas
• Tá rialacha comónta acu faoi víosaí iontrála agus gearrchónaithe
• They have removed checks at their common borders and have checks only at the external borders; there are separate arrangements at airports for people travelling within the Schengen area

• Tá seiceálacha bainte amach acu ag comhtheorainneacha agus is ag teorainneacha seachtracha amháin a tharlaíonn seiceálacha; tá socruithe ar leith ag aerfoirt do dhaoine atá ag taisteal laistigh de limistéar Schengen

• They have arrangements for co-ordination between the police, customs and the judiciary in the Schengen area states and for taking measures to combat terrorism and organised crime; this can include rights of hot pursuit

• Tá socruithe comhordaithe i bhfeidhm idir na póilíní, lucht custaim agus na breithiúna sna stáit i limistéar Schengen, agus chun bearta a thógáil do chomhrac na sceimhlitheoireachta agus na coiriúlachta eagraithe; d'fhéadfadh cearta maidir le tóraíocht thréan a bheith san áireamh

The Schengen Convention allows people who are legally present in one of the participating countries to travel to any of the other participating countries without having any border checks when crossing internal frontiers

Ceadaíonn Coinbhinsiún Schengen do dhaoine atá i gceann de na tíortha rannpháirteacha go dlíthiúil taisteal chuig ceann ar bith de na tíortha rannpháirteacha eile; ní dhéanfar aon seiceálacha teorann orthu nuair atá teorainneacha inmheánacha á dtrasnú acu

Internal frontiers are defined as the national boundaries between the countries taking part in the Schengen Convention, together with airports and seaports in the case of traffic to and from a Schengen country

Déantar teorainneacha inmheánacha a shainiú mar theorainneacha náisiúnta idir thíortha atá rannpháirteach i gCoinbhinsiún Schengen, chomh maith le haerfoirt agus calafoirt i gcás tráchta go dtí tír Schengen agus ar ais as
Travellers may cross the internal frontiers wherever and whenever they like without having to undergo personal checks
Is féidir le taistealaithe na teorainneacha inmheánacha a thrasnú in áit ar bith agus ag am ar bith - ní bheidh gá seiceálacha pearsanta a dhéanamh orthu
However, anyone who enters or leaves the Schengen zone is subject to the normal checks
Mar sin féin, tá duine ar bith a iontrálann nó a fhágann crios Schengen faoi réir na seiceálacha mar is gnáth
This does not mean that you can travel without identity documents
Ní chiallaíonn sé seo gur féidir leat taisteal gan doiciméid aitheantais
Many of the countries concerned require their own citizens as well as others to carry some form of ID
Bíonn foirm aitheantais áirithe de dhíth ag tromlach na dtíortha atá i gceist maidir lena gcuid saoránaigh féin agus daoine eile
You may need a passport or other form of ID to establish your entitlement to travel freely
D'fhéadfadh pas nó foirm aitheantais eile a bheith de dhíth ort chun do theidlíocht do shaoirse taistil a bhunú
If you are legally in one participating country and you travel into another you may move around for 3 months without any checks
Má tá tú i dtír rannpháirteach amháin go dlíthiúil agus go dtaistealaíonn tú chuig tír eile, is féidir leat gluaiseacht thart ar feadh 3 mhí gan seiceálacha ar bith
After that, your right to remain in the other country is subject to the rules in respect of taking up residence in another country
Ina dhiaidh sin, tá do cheart fanacht i dtír eile faoi réir na rialacha cónaitheachta i dtír eile
Asylum seekers in one participating country are not entitled to travel freely to another
Níl saorchead ag lucht iarrtha tearmainn i dtír rannpháirteach amháin taisteal go tír eile
They are subject to the rules set out in the Dublin III Regulation on the country to which their application for asylum must be made
Tá siad faoi réir na rialacha atá leagtha síos i Rialachán Coinbhinsiún Bhaile Átha Cliath III maidir leis an tír lena bhfuil a n-iarratas ar thearmann déanta

Schengen Borders Code: Regulation (EC) No 562/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 15 March 2006 established a Community Code on the rules governing the movement of persons across borders

Cód Teorainneacha Schengen: Bhunaigh Rialachán (CE) Uimhir 562/2006 de Pharlaimint na hEorpa agus den Chomhairle Eorpach Cód Pobail ar an 15 Márta 2006, maidir leis na rialacha a rialaíonn gluaiseacht daoine trasna teorainneacha
A Schengen visa is a visa issued by one of the participating countries to third country nationals
Is víosa í Víosa Schengen atá eisithe ag ceann de na tíortha rannpháirteacha chuig náisiúnaigh as tríú tíortha
If you have a visa to travel to one Schengen country, you do not need a further visa to travel to the others
Má tá víosa agat chun taisteal go tír Schengen amháin, ní gá duit víosa bhreise a bheith agat chun taisteal chuig cinn eile
If you have a valid residence permit in one Schengen country you can travel to the others without needing a visa (in effect, a residence permit from a Schengen country is the same as a Schengen visa)
Má tá ceadúnas cónaithe bailí agat i dtír Schengen amháin, is féidir leat taisteal chuig na tíortha eile gan víosa (tá ceadúnas cónaithe ó thír Schengen cosúil le víosa Schengen go bunúsach)
The Schengen Information System (SIS) is a database set up to facilitate the exchange of data on people's identities and descriptions of objects that were either stolen or lost
Is bunachar sonraí é Córas Faisnéise Schengen (CFS) atá bunaithe chun aistriú sonraí a éascú maidir le céannachtaí daoine agus cur síos ar rudaí atá goidte nó caillte
It is available to the authorities in the participating countries
Tá an córas ar fáil do na húdaráis sna tíortha rannpháirteacha
It is accessible by them only to the extent that they take part in the Schengen arrangements
Tá sé inrochtana acu amháin sa mhéid is go bhfuil siad rannpháirteach i socruithe Schengen
A new system SIS II has been developed and entered into operation on 9 April 2013
Tá córas nua CFS-II forbartha agus cuireadh i bhfeidhm an 10 Aibreán 2013
Ireland has agreed to opt in to the SIS II system
Roghnaigh Éire a bheith páirteach i gcóras CFS II
Frontex is the EU Agency for the Management of Operational Cooperation at the External Borders of the Member States
Is Gníomhaireacht AE chun Comhar Oibríochtúil a Bhainistiú ag Teorainneacha Seachtracha na mBallstát í Frontex
It is based in Warsaw and was set up to co-ordinate the activities of member states in the field of border security
Tá sí lonnaithe i Vársá agus bunaithe le gníomhaíochtaí na mballstát a chomhordú i réimse na slándála teorann
Responsibility for the control and surveillance of external borders lies with the member states
Luíonn an fhreagracht ar na ballstáit maidir le rialú agus faireachas na dteorainneacha seachtracha
Frontex was established by Regulation (EC) 2007/2004
Bhunaigh Rialachán (CE) 2007/2004 Frontex
Ireland and the UK are not involved
Níl baint ag Éirinn ná an Ríocht Aontaithe leis na cúrsaí seo
The original Schengen Convention (agreed in 1985) was an international agreement between the countries who agreed to be bound by it
Is comhaontú idirnáisiúnta a bhí sa Choinbhinsiún Schengen bunaidh (a aontaíodh in 1985) idir thíortha a d'aontaigh a bheith faoi cheangal aige
A further convention was agreed in 1990
Aontaíodh coinbhinsiún breise in 1990
The Convention came into effect in 1995
Tháinig an Coinbhinsiún i bhfeidhm in 1995
In 1998, the conventions became part of EU law when the Treaty of Amsterdam came into effect
Rinneadh na coinbhinsiúin a áireamh mar chuid de dhlí an AE in 1998 nuair a tháinig Conradh Amstardam i bhfeidhm
Ireland is not part of the Schengen arrangements on travel and visas
Níl socruithe Schengen ar thaisteal agus víosaí curtha i bhfeidhm in Éirinn
It is open to Ireland to take part in these arrangements if all of the Schengen members and a representative of the Irish government vote unanimously in favour within the Council of the EU
Tá oscailt ann d'Éirinn a bheith páirteach sna socruithe seo, má dhéanann gach ball Schengen agus ionadaí Rialtais na hÉireann vótáil d'aonghuth i bhfabhar laistigh de Chomhairle an AE
This means that Irish people are subject to passport checks at the borders of other EU member states
Ciallaíonn sé seo go bhfuil muintir na hÉireann faoi réir sheiceálacha pas ag teorainneacha na mballstát AE eile
The External Borders Fund
Ciste na dTeorainneacha Seachtracha
The External Borders Fund aims to help with the creation of an efficient, high and uniform level of control at the external borders
Tá Ciste na dTeorainneacha Seachtracha dírithe ar chúnamh a thabhairt maidir le leibhéal rialaithe a chruthú ag teorainneacha seachtracha atá éifeachtach, ar ardchaighdeán agus aonfhoirmeach
Ireland is not involved
Níl baint ag Éirinn leis na cúrsaí seo
The Prüm Treaty is sometimes referred to as Schengen Plus
Déantar tagairt uaireanta do Chonradh Prüm mar Schengen Plus
It was signed on 27 May 2005 by 7 countries - France, Germany, Spain, Austria, Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxembourg
Shínigh 7 dtír é ar an 27 Bealtaine 2005 - an Fhrainc, an Ghearmáin, an Spáinn, an Ostair, an Bheilg, an Ísiltír, Lucsamburg
They agreed to increase their co-operation in order fight against terrorism, cross border crime and illegal migration
D'aontaigh siad comhoibriú a mhéadú chun troid in aghaidh na sceimhlitheoireachta, na coiriúlachta trasteorann agus na himirce neamhdhleathaigh
The agreement allows for the exchange of data on finger prints and genetic information
Ceadaíonn an comhaontú do mhalartú sonraí maidir le méarloirg agus faisnéis ghéiniteach
The agreement is open to other Schengen member states
Tá oscailt sa chomhaontú do bhallstáit Schengen eile
This is an international agreement between the countries concerned
Is comhaontú idirnáisiúnta é seo idir na tíortha atá bainteach
It has no connection at present with EU law
Níl aon cheangal aige le dlí an AE i láthair na huaire
